docblock.description: wow_ah_test.php is a simple command line interface for testing the wow_ah API
docblock.long-description:
Commands: + help + login:`username`:`password` + get_character_list + select_character:`#` + get_money + get_mail + get_mail_info + get_character + update_inventory + update_auctions + search:`name`:`category`:`minlevel`:`maxlevel`:`quality`:`sort`:`reverse`:`limit`:`item_id` + bid:`auction_id`:`amount` + create_auction:`item_id`:`duration`:`quantity`:`stacks`:`buyout per item`:`bid per item` + cancel_auction:`auction_id` + take_money:`mail_ids` + take_all_money + flush_log
Copyright (C) 2016 Aram Akhavan <kaysond@hotmail.com>
This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.
You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

tag.name: copyright

docblock.description: wow_ah.class.php is a low level API for accessing the World of Warcraft Auction House via the Armory website
docblock.long-description:
Contains the main API class (wow_ah\wow_ah) and necessary helper classes, objects, and functions
Copyright (C) 2016 Aram Akhavan <kaysond@hotmail.com>
This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.
You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

tag.name: author
tag.description: Aram Akhavan

tag.name: copyright
tag.description: 2016 Aram Akhavan

docblock.description: Whether the API should log its transactions
Whether the API should log all HTTP requests and responses
How many times the battle.net server can redirect the API to the login page before the API considers the user logged out
How many seconds to wait at minimum before flushing the log buffer to the file.
How many transactions are allowed before certain functions are disabled
Location of the file containing additional JavaScript for the login procedure
The main API class

tag.name: var
tag.description: cURL resource

tag.name: var
tag.description: Location of the cURL cookie jar/file

tag.name: var
tag.description: The battle.net region specified by the user in the constructor

tag.name: var
tag.description: The battle.net language specified by the user in the constructor

tag.name: var
tag.description: A browser_info object the API uses to generate HTTP requests

tag.name: var
tag.description: JSON-encoded browser fingerprint

tag.name: var
tag.description: An indexed array listing all of the accounts character's, where the 0th index is the selected character for API transactions

tag.name: var
tag.description: An associative array containing the character information occasionally sent by the server

tag.name: var
tag.description: The amount of money the selected character has

tag.name: var
tag.description: The contents of the character's mail

tag.name: var
tag.description: The "mail_info" sent by the servers, containing the number of messages, and the maximum number allowed

tag.name: var
tag.description: The contents of the selected character's inventory (bags, mail, and bank)

tag.name: var
tag.description: All of the auctions for the selected character.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The number of transactions executed by the API

tag.name: var
tag.description: Some sort of cross-site token for battle.net, sent with some requests

tag.name: var
tag.description: Whether the API thinks the character is logged in to battle.net

tag.name: var
tag.description: Whether the API has detected that the account is logged into the game client

tag.name: var
tag.description: How many times an HTTP request has been 302 redirected to the login page (in a row)

tag.name: var
tag.description: The last HTTP transaction made by the API, for error handling.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The location of the log file

tag.name: var
tag.description: A buffer for log entries so the disk access is not excessive

tag.name: var
tag.description: Timestamp of the last log flush to file

docblock.description: Constructs the API
docblock.long-description: The constructor sets the Battle.net region, the language, the location of the curl cookie file, the log file, and information about the browser that the API will present

tag.name: param
tag.description: Battle.net region to use as the subdomain (e.g. "us")

tag.name: param
tag.description: Battle.net language (e.g. "en", used in the url as /wow/en/)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Location of the file that stores cookies

tag.name: param
tag.description: Location of the log file. This contains errors and log entries

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing information about the browser

docblock.description: Checks if the API thinks the user is logged in
docblock.long-description: The API keeps track of when the user has logged in. There is some issue with the Blizzard servers that intermittently causes the session cookies to become invalid on their end, resulting in all requests returning HTTP code 302. If this happens too many times, the API will assume such an issue has occurred, and the user must re-login.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the user is logged in

docblock.description: Gets the list of characters associated with the account
docblock.long-description: Returns all of the characters on the account. The character at index 0 is being used for the API transactions.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An indexed array of all the characters on the account

docblock.description: Gets information about the selected character
docblock.long-description: Certain requests to the Armory return a JSON object containing information about the selected character such as Realm, race, talents, class, faction, etc. This is stored without any formatting as an associative array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array with information about the selected character

docblock.description: Gets the amount of money the current character has

tag.name: return
tag.description: The amount of money in copper

docblock.description: Gets the contents of the character's mailbox
docblock.long-description: The Armory website occasionally sends AJAX requests to get the character's mail contents and that is stored without any formatting.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array with the character's mail content

docblock.description: Gets the number of messages in the mailbox

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array containing the max, current, and total messages

docblock.description: Gets the contents of the selected character's inventory, bank, and mail
docblock.long-description: Returns an array of inventory_item objects representing the selected character's inventory. This must first be populated with update_inventory()

tag.name: return
tag.description: An indexed array containing one object per inventory item

docblock.description: Gets the auctions of the selected character
docblock.long-description: Returns an object containing three properties (active, sold, ended) each of which is an array containing its respective type of *_auction object. This must first be populated with update_auctions()

tag.name: return
tag.description: An auctions object

docblock.description: Returns the number of transactions executed by the API
docblock.long-description: The Armory has a limit of 200 transactions per day, so the API keeps track of every auction won and every auction created (each stack counts as one). After this number hits a user-defined limit it will disable bidding and auction creation. It cannot keep track of transactions made outside the API.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of transactions executed by the API

docblock.description: Resets the tracked transaction count to zero.
Check if the account is logged into the game
docblock.long-description: If the account is logged into the game, certain Armory features are disabled, and the same are disabled in the API. Searching is essentially the only usable feature when this happens.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the server response indicates that a character is logged in

docblock.description: Takes the number of copper and returns a "decimal" string of gold (i.e. "gggg.ss.cc")

tag.name: param
tag.description: The amount of money in copper

tag.name: return
tag.description: The formatted string

docblock.description: Logs the user in
docblock.long-description: Login procedure: + GET https://worldofwarcraft.com/{lang}-{region}/ - no referrer + GET https://worldofwarcraft.com/{lang}-{region}/login - referrer https://worldofwarcraft.com/en-us/ + Follow redirects to the login page, which should match the url {region}.battle.net/login/{lang}/ and return a code 200 + Check for captcha + POST srp info - referer login form url + POST login form - referer login form url + If the last url is the login form - bad password. + If the last url is authenticator, send status checks until accepted, then GET authenticator url + 17 digit random number - referer authenticator url + Should end up at wow website, which should match the url https://worldofwarcraft.com/{lang}-{region}/ with a code 200 + GET the first character URL (matching http://{region}.battle.net/wow/{lang}/character/{server}/{character}/simple) - referer wow website + Make sure you actually get there + Get auction house index - referer first character URL

tag.name: param
tag.description: Battle.net username

tag.name: param
tag.description: Battle.net password

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success

docblock.description: Selects a character to be used for API transactions
docblock.long-description: Whichever character is in the 0'th index of the character list is used for all API transactions. This function moves the selected character to that index, so the whole character list will change.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Index of the character to be used, from get_character_list()

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success

docblock.description: Performs a search of the auction house
docblock.long-description: Searches the auction house. For all filters, a value of -1 (int or string) disables them. Specifying an item_id guarantees only that item is returned, and still allows for filtering. Some error checking is performed on values that are not entered raw on the website. The API pauses for 1 second between consecutive requests (the website returns a maximum of 40 results at a time) for a single search. The Armory returns only the first 200 results.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Item name

tag.name: param
tag.description: Category, subcategory, and sub-sub category, separated by commas (see categories.txt) (e.g. 0,2)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Minimum level

tag.name: param
tag.description: Maximum level

tag.name: param
tag.description: Minimum item quality (0 = Poor, 1 = Common, 2 = Uncommon, 3 = Rare, 4 = Epic)

tag.name: param
tag.description: How to sort results ("rarity", "quantity", "level", "ilvl", "time", "bid", "unitBid", "buyout", "unitBuyout")

tag.name: param
tag.description: True is descending, false is ascending

tag.name: param
tag.description: How many auctions to return, -1 for all (Armory limits to 200)

tag.name: param
tag.description: A user-specified time stamp (mysql format, e.g. date("Y-m-d H:i:s")) to add to all results of this search. Useful for data analysis

tag.name: param
tag.description: WoW item id. When this is not 0, disables name, category, minlevel, maxlevel, and quality fields

tag.name: return
tag.description: An indexed array of search result objects, in the sort order specified.

docblock.description: Bid on an auction
docblock.long-description: If the bid amount is equal to or higher than the buyout, it will automatically result in buying out the auction.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The auction id

tag.name: param
tag.description: The bid amount in copper

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the bid results in a buyout, false if it is just a high bid

docblock.description: Update the selected character's inventory
docblock.long-description: Sends a request to .../auction/create and parses the inventory from the CDATA. Since this link could be clicked from anywhere, an optional referer parameter is provided. The inventory contains all items in the bags, bank, and mail. The inventory is stored in the API and can be retrieved without an update by using get_inventory().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL of the referer to use when making the page request

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an array of objects representing items in the inventory

docblock.description: Create an auction on the ah
docblock.long-description: Performs some error checking then submits a number of requests as necessary to list auctions on the auction house

tag.name: param
tag.description: item id

tag.name: param
tag.description: auction duration (0 = 12 hours, 1 = 24 hours, 2 = 48 hours)

tag.name: param
tag.description: quantity per stack

tag.name: param
tag.description: number of stacks

tag.name: param
tag.description: buyout price in copper

tag.name: param
tag.description: bid price in copper

tag.name: param
tag.description: prices given per item (false = per stack)

tag.name: param
tag.description: from where to withdraw items (0 = all [bags, bank, and mail], 1 = bags, 2 = bank, 3 = mail)

tag.name: return
tag.description: True on success

docblock.description: Updates the selected characters auctions (active, sold, and ended)

tag.name: return
tag.description: An auctions object containing arrays of active_auction, sold_auction, ended_auction

docblock.description: Cancels an auction

tag.name: param
tag.description: id of the auction to cancel

docblock.description: Takes money from auction profits in the selected character's mailbox
docblock.long-description: Takes the money from the passed mail id's. Mail id's can be obtained either from get_auctions() or get_mail().

tag.name: param
tag.description: Mail id's, separated by commas

tag.name: return
tag.description: The amount of money obtained, in copper

docblock.description: Helper function to take all available money
docblock.long-description: Calls update_auctions(), concatenates mail id's from sold auctions that are claimable and passes them to take_money()

tag.name: return
tag.description: The amount of money taken in copper, 0 if there are no auctions

docblock.description: Cleanly shuts down the API
docblock.long-description: This method should always be used to shut down the API since it will call curl_close() which actually writes the cookies to the cookie file. It also flushes the log buffer.

docblock.description: Sets up some curl parameters during construction
Retrieves the character's gold amount and the character information
docblock.long-description: Calls to this method happen automatically as necessary in the course of other transactions, to mimic the website.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The url of the referer to use for HTTP requests

docblock.description: Retrieves the character's mailbox and mail information
docblock.long-description: Calls to this method happen automatically as necessary in the course of other transactions, to mimic the website.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The url of the referer to use for HTTP requests

docblock.description: Parses search results from an HTTP response into an array of objects

tag.name: param
tag.description: An HTTP response body

tag.name: param
tag.description: A timestamp (in mysql format e.g. date("Y-m-d H:i:s")) to add to each of the parsed results (useful for data analysis)

tag.name: return
tag.description: An indexed array of search_result objects

docblock.description: Parses the character list and xstoken from an HTTP response from .
docblock.long-description: .../auction/index

tag.name: param
tag.description: An HTTP response body

docblock.description: Generates a browser fingerprint
docblock.long-description:
In constructing the API, information must be supplied describing the browser the API is to mimic. During login, the website generates a fingerprint for the browser using javascript.

The strategy is to use random results for complicated keys, since they're not likely to be reversed, but actually hash more regular things like useragent, language, etc.

Element 2 is always "24", 10 is always "false", 11 is always "0;false;false"

The whole structure is sent as a JSON encoded array

Each element is a base64 encoded murmur3 hash (x86,32bit) of the following fingerprintjs2 sources (.join()'ed with ';' so everything is a string):

+ 0: userAgentKey (e.g. "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:48.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/48.0") + 1: languageKey (e.g. "en-US"), + 2: colorDepthKey (e.g. 24) + 3: screenResolutionKey (e.g. [1200, 1920],[1200,1920]) + 4: timezoneOffsetKey (e.g. 420, from (new Date).getTimezoneOffset, which is minutes behind GMT) + 5: cpuClassKey (e.g. "navigatorCpuClass: unknown") + 6: platformKey (e.g. "navigatorPlatform: Win32") + 7: pluginsKey (e.g. "ActiveTouch General Plugin Container::ActiveTouch General Plugin Container Version 105::application/x-atgpc-plugin~gpc;")" + 10: getHasLiedLanguages() || getHasLiedResolution() || getHasLiedOs() || getHasLiedBrowser() (send "false") + 11: touchSupportKey (e.g. [0, false, false]), + 12: fontsKey (e.g. "Aharoni;Algerian;Andalus;Angsana New;AngsanaUPC;Aparajita;Arabic Typesetting;Arial")

tag.name: param
tag.description: A browser_info object

tag.name: return
tag.description: JSON representation of the fingerprint

docblock.description: Makes an HTTP Request
docblock.long-description: Low-level method to actually make HTTP requests using cURL. Keeps track of how many 302 redirects to the login page are received so the API can detect when the server thinks it is no longer logged in. POST requests are automatically generated as needed if $postdata is not false.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to make a request to

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of additional headers where keys are the header, and values are the header value (i.e. array("Accept-Language" => "en"))

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL of the referer to use or false to leave it out

tag.name: param
tag.description: A url-encoded string for data in POST requests

tag.name: return
tag.description: An http_transaction object containing request and response information

docblock.description: A custom function to handle errors from libxml by throwing wow_ah\Exceptions on fatal errors and logging the rest

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the errors from libxml

tag.name: param
tag.description: A description of what is being parsed, to be used in log and error messages

docblock.description: Convenience function for warnings

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the warning

docblock.description: Add an entry to the log
docblock.long-description: Log entries are buffered and flushed at a minimum specified interval (LOG_API_INTERVAL) to avoid a disk write bottleneck when the API is used very fast. The logs only get flushed when a new log entry is generated, so it is possible to lose entries if the API shuts down unexpectedly. flush_log() can be used to manually flush the buffer, and is automatically called by close().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The log entry

docblock.description: Manually flushes the log buffer to disk
A wow_ah extension of object_from_array that throws wow_ah\exceptions when errors are encountered

tag.name: var

docblock.description: A custom exception for wow_ah
docblock.long-description:
The wow_ah\Exception stores the last http transaction, and allows for chaining of exceptions, so an error can be traced through the API. The last http transaction is automatically passed up the chain unless a new link has a transaction specified. Exception messages are automatically logged to the file set by set_logfile().
Error codes can be or'd with the ERROR_BUT_RETRY when the API suggests the operation did not "hard" fail (e.g. redirect to login page, which happens intermittently but regularly for no reason)

docblock.description: Error flag that indicates the operation should be retried (e.g. received incorrect 302 redirect to login page)

tag.name: var
tag.description: An http_transaction object for the last transaction before the exception was thrown

tag.name: var
tag.description: Location of the error log file

docblock.description: Creates the exception

tag.name: param
tag.description: The exception message

tag.name: param
tag.description: An http_transaction for the last transaction made before the exception was thrown

tag.name: param
tag.description: The error code

tag.name: param
tag.description: The previous exception, if any

docblock.description: Return all exception messages in a chain

tag.name: return
tag.description: An indexed array of exception messages

docblock.description: Logs the last http transaction made before the exception in case LOG_HTTP is false
Sets the file where exception messages are logged

tag.name: param
tag.description: The location of the log file
